verses.verse: Take heed to yourself that you do not forsake the Levite as long as you live in your land.

“When the LORD your God (Gen. 15:18; Ex. 34:24; Deut. 11:24; 19:8) enlarges your border as He has promised you, and you say, ‘Let me eat meat,’ because you long to eat meat, you may eat as much meat as your heart desires.

If the place where the LORD your God chooses to put His name is too far from (Deut. 14:24) you, then you may slaughter from your herd and from your flock which the LORD has given you, just as I have commanded you, and you may eat within your gates as much as your heart desires.
Just as the gazelle and the deer are eaten, so you may eat them; the unclean and the clean alike may eat them.
Only be sure that you do not eat the blood, (Gen. 9:4; Lev. 17:10-14; Deut. 12:16) for the blood is the life; you may not eat the life with the meat.
You shall not eat it; you shall pour it on the earth like water.
You shall not eat it, (Deut. 4:40; 6:18; Is. 3:10) that it may go well with you and your children after you, (Ex. 15:26; 1 Kin. 11:38) when you do what is right in the sight of the LORD.
Only the (Num. 5:9, 10; 18:19) holy things which you have, and your vowed offerings, you shall take and go to the place which the LORD chooses.

And (Lev. 1:5, 9, 13, 17) you shall offer your burnt offerings, the meat and the blood, on the altar of the LORD your God; and the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out on the altar of the LORD your God, and you shall eat the meat.

Observe and obey all these words which I command you, (Deut. 12:25) that it may go well with you and your children after you forever, when you do what is good and right in the sight of the LORD your God.
(Beware of False Gods) “When (Ex. 23:23; Deut. 19:1; Josh. 23:4) the LORD your God cuts off from before you the nations which you go to dispossess, and you displace them and dwell in their land,

take heed to yourself that you are not ensnared to follow them, after they are destroyed from before you, and that you do not inquire after their gods, saying, ‘How did these nations serve their gods? I also will do likewise.’

(Lev. 18:3, 26, 30; 20:1, 2) You shall not worship the LORD your God in that way; for every abomination to the LORD which He hates they have done to their gods; for (Deut. 18:10; Ps. 106:37; Jer. 32:35) they burn even their sons and daughters in the fire to their gods.
“Whatever I command you, be careful to observe it; (Deut. 4:2; 13:18; Josh. 1:7; Prov. 30:6; Rev. 22:18, 19) you shall not add to it nor take away from it.
(Punishment of Apostates) “If there arises among you a prophet or a (Num. 12:6; Jer. 23:28; Zech. 10:2) dreamer of dreams, (Matt. 24:24; Mark 13:22; 2 Thess. 2:9) and he gives you a sign or a wonder,
and (Deut. 18:22) the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, ‘Let us go after other gods’—which you have not known—‘and let us serve them,’

you shall not listen to the words of that prophet or that dreamer of dreams, for the LORD your God (Ex. 20:20; Deut. 8:2, 16) is testing you to know whether you love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
You shall (Deut. 10:12, 20; 2 Kin. 23:3) walk after the LORD your God and fear Him, and keep His commandments and obey His voice; you shall serve Him and (Deut. 30:20) hold fast to Him.
